content: Delivered globe, amp, citizen-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""Globe & Citizen Web3.0 Job Posting# WHAT:Welcome to Globe & Citizen! An international startup seeking to become Web3.0's premier distributed news network. Our company is based around 3 projects:- "Celebrity Fanalyzer" (to be rebranded as "Globe & Citizen: News of Our World" in 2025)- Layer8 (A browser based end-to-end-encryption proxy)- Crypto Native Corporation Portal (A web portal for creating Crypto Native Corporations)What is a Crypto Native Corporation (CNC)? A CNC is a company that has an analogous structure to any corporation except that it can be, from the very beginning, globally distributed because it uses crypto as it’s primary medium of economic exchange and governance (see the attached extended explanation, “What_and_Why_of_CNCs.docx”).# WHY:To improve our world and get rich while we do it.# WHO:1 – 4 junior web3 developers with big ambitions! The ideal candidate will be very ambitious and not afraid to learn! Currently the team is comprised of 6 developers and 4 auxiliary members. Spread around the world in Nigeria, Singapore, Venezuela, Pakistan, Uzbekistan, Togo, Brazil, and Canada.# WHERE:Fully remote. You will meet with your team lead for one on ones weekly and join a weekly team meeting. In addition, you will meet with me (the Chief Policy Officer & financier) at least monthly. Ad hoc meetings are also encouraged. All financial transactions will be done through UpWork. We communite using Discord as well and you will upload all your work to one of Globe & Citizen’s Github repos.# PROJECT SUMMARIES:## “Globe & Citizen: News of Our World”Globe & Citizen is dedicated to sanitizing user data so that the anonymized aggregate can be publicly analyzed so that users can decided their own truth about world events. In order to accomplish this, you will complete development of [REDACTED_URL] which is actually Globe & Citizen in stealth mode (see the attached). Your will:- Converting Celebrity Fanalyzer into a DAPP so that the monthly competitions can be run using Ethereum instead of fiat currency (what we have been doing).- Experimenting with how anonymized data can be analyzed and then reflected back to users.- Optimizing. Celebrity Fanalyzer is a Progressive Web App built using Quasar and VueJS## “Layer8: A Browser Based E2E Encryption Proxy”Built using Golang compiled to WASM, Layer8 routes http traffic through a custom server that strips identifying headers before sending the encrypted payload on to a service provider. This has the effect of separating your true identity from your content choices online. Once sanitized, user data can then be aggregated for public analysis and presentation by a service provider.## “Crypto Native Corporation Portal (CNC Portal)”Our goal in 2024 is to complete development of our MVP (Celebrity Fanalyzer + Layer8) while pretending to be 3 different companies entering into smart contracts with each other. Governance and finance for these three pretend “companies” will be done using the CNC Portal that YOU will build using the attached mocks as a guide.The CNC is to be what Github is to Git for anyone wanting to build open source. In short, though a centralized platform is planned, it will facilitate decentralized companies spread around the globe and this is our vision. Why a centralized platform? Because, in the words of Signals founder, “We should accept the premise that people will not run their own servers by designing systems that can distribute trust without having to distribute infrastructure. This means architecture that anticipates and accepts the inevitable outcome of relatively centralized client/server relationships, but uses cryptography (rather than infrastructure) to distribute trust.”# WHY SHOULD I JOIN GLOBE AND CITIZEN?We are an early stage company and your primary task will be to iterate on functionality. This is the most exciting part of software development because it is functionality that defines a product in the minds of users! We are also sustainably self funded which means that we put a premium on the learning and development of our people. We hope you will learn, experiment and bring forward your ideas!# HOW TO APPLYTo begin with, you will join either team Globe&Citizen or team CNC Portal (thougheventually you are like to participate in all projects).1) Apply to this post -- see the 4 questions2) Attend a 1 hour interview.# ABOUT THE COMPANY:Globe & Citizen first came into being October 2022 when the first hires joined on Upwork (all of whom are still with the company 16 months later!) It’s a worker driven company seeking to pioneer a fully remote, globally distributed, business model.# REQUIREMENTS:English. A robust Internet connection. Relevant development experience. And, again, be ready to learn, and learn, and learn. You will joing to work AND push yourslef to develop professionally.Hourly Range: $8.00-$20.00Posted On: February 19, 2024 16:47 UTCCategory: Full Stack DevelopmentSkills:Vue.js, Node.js, Golang, Web Application, PostgreSQL, JavaScript, Web3Skills: Vue.js, Node.js, Golang, Web Application, PostgreSQL, JavaScript, Web3Country: Canada""

""I need at least 3 concept designs for a dog shelter.Here are some constraints and conditions we have:- The weather is desertic: sand is present everywhere, need to be considered materials that would resist corrosion and covers to be able to isolate from sand to come in when there is strong wind . the weather is dry. During summer it would be very hot and during winter very cold.- The place needs ventilation: both natural and artificial- Needs to house at least 300 dogs, considering at least 5m2 per dog.- Needs to have a separate set of buildings for moms and puppies.- Needs to be done in a way that it is easy to clean- Consider the water is not available in huge quantities- Needs to have common spaces and individual spaces- Needs to have a "quarantine area" particularly ventilated- Needs to have a office, and an area of guard/sleeping for people in shift and an area for adopters to come and meet the dogs.- needs to have a way to provide water in common areas- Needs to have a warehouse for food with entrance directly from the road and entrance from the inside of the shelter. This should be next to a place for vehicles with the same concept.- every space in which the dogs have a space either common or individual needs to have a separate "way" in which staff of the shelter or visitors can move without making dogs escape .- Needs to have a clinic with an external area entrance and an internal one. At least 4 rooms and an area of recovery for dogs treated, at least 20 cages (even on 2 levels).- needs to have a place adiacent to clinic where pets can be cleaned.- needs to have a place for disabled dogs (so no stairs but ramps, no hard floor (meaning something smooth) and a dedicated common/external area).- all entrances of common areas should have a cleaning area for dogs (meaning there should be a smaller entrance to be able to stop and clean or check the dogs).- there has to be plenty of lightMOST importantly, consider that the budget is limited as well as the availability of materials, so the best is using and visualizing the concept with easy to find materials, preferably modular construction.I need 3 concepts high level, i expect a 3d design, drawings, complete description, materials choices and why and presentation, touching the points made in this description post.If one of the designs is selected, we will proceed with a second job with the detailed planning and design of the site.Budget: $200Posted On: February 14, 2024 18:05 UTCCategory: Architectural DesignSkills:Concept Design, Industrial Architecture, Urban Planning, Architectural Design, 3D Design, Architecture & Interior Design, CADSkills: Concept Design, Industrial Architecture, Urban Planning, Architectural Design, 3D Design, Architecture & Interior Design, CADCountry: United Kingdom""

Overall, there are about 22-30 paths each taking learners 20-50 mins to completeThe way I would imagine it, the authors prepare everything information-wise. But since they are not experts in interactive digital education, this is where we need your support. Once the authors make the first cohesive version of the path, you will take over. Ideally, you can finalize the path yourself - if needed, rewrite some texts, add questions, and make it pretty. If information is missing or you suggest adding something that you aren't able to add yourself, we can get in touch with the authors to do it. original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""A manual tester is a professional responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of software applications or systems through manual testing processes. Unlike automated testing, which involves the use of scripts and tools to execute predefined test cases, manual testing relies on human intuition, observation, and experience to assess software behavior in real-world scenarios.Manual testers typically follow test plans and execute test cases to identify bugs, defects, or inconsistencies in the software's behavior. They meticulously document their findings, including steps to reproduce issues and any relevant information that can help developers understand and address the problems.Key responsibilities of a manual tester may include:Understanding project requirements and specifications.Developing test cases and scenarios based on requirements.Executing test cases manually to identify defects or issues.Logging defects and communicating them effectively to the development team.Participating in test case reviews and providing feedback on testability aspects.Collaborating with developers, business analysts, and other stakeholders to ensure comprehensive test coverage.Conducting regression testing to ensure that previously identified issues have been resolved and new changes haven't introduced new problems.Providing input for improving testing processes and methodologies.Ensuring that software meets quality standards and user expectations before release.Manual testers play a crucial role in the software development lifecycle by providing valuable feedback and helping to ensure that software products meet quality standards and user expectations. Their attention to detail, critical thinking skills, and ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders are essential for delivering high-quality software solutions.Hourly Range: $10.00-$21.00Posted On: February 23, 2024 10:27 UTCCategory: Manual TestingSkills:Software QA, Functional Testing, Web Testing, Manual Testing, Bug Reports, Jira, Mobile App Testing, QA Engineering, Regression Test Script, Quality AssuranceSkills: Software QA, Functional Testing, Web Testing, Manual Testing, Bug Reports, Jira, Mobile App Testing, QA Engineering, Regression Test Script, Quality AssuranceCountry: India""

content: Delivered backgroundseeking, support, with-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""BACKGROUNDSeeking support with bringing a new business concept to life through a document or slide deck that captures what, who, how, why, so what for a new integrated coaching business in the love and relationship space.This work is in prep for working with other creatives on brand identity, tone of voice, messaging etc. Whereas contractors those backgrounds are welcome to apply, we aren’t quite ready and settled to commit to formative brand work yet (nor the price tag that comes along with that.)IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILEThe ideal person has experience in the sacred spirituality, wellness, and/or coaching space. But they may also just be a very intuitive person and storyteller and writer who personally connects with the mission and potential impact of a coaching platform that spans spirituality, neuroscience, media, and social justice.Regardless, the ideal candidate will be willing to engage in live discussions as a way of mind-melding to effectively capture the essence of the brand, and be disciplined enough to play back progress for asynchronous collaboration and feedback along the way.PREFERRED ENGAGEMENT MODELWe would prefer a fixed fee engagement model for this given the exploratory scribe-to-story nature of the work. We also expect and will only work with writers who have learned how to use AI to assist the note taking and editing process (vs those who would use AI as a replacement for actual writing).TLDR we could do this ourselves by simply recording our thoughts and using AI to transcribe and produce copy. But great stories are sculpted by great questioners, interviewers, and seekers; value the interviewing and facilitation skills, the art of great copy, and the accountability that comes with partnering with another creative on this. Hence this call is for the right partner to prepare and deliver the right questions via a series of sessions (30-45 mins, depending on the topic) over the next few weeks.PHASE 0: TO GET STARTED- Align on Scope, Plan, Pricing, and Sign Contract and NDA- Scope Re-clarification: Align on timeline for delivery, progress milestones and acceptance criteria for the target deliverables.- Project Kickoff to setup and review workspace (including access to available materials), schedule sessions, and expectations around communication and collaboration.- Asynchronously: Sign-off on Scope, Timeline, Fund Initial MilestonePHASE 1: INTERVIEW TO INSIGHTSWeek 1 (1-2 sessions)- Topic 1a: Background & Why- Topic 1b: Business Mission & Target Impact- Week 1 Conversation Summary & Playback DeliveredWeek 2 (1-2 sessions)- Topic 2a: Target Audience (Broad)- Topic 2b: Ideal Client Profile(s) (Specifics)- Week 2 Conversation Summary & Playback DeliveredWeek 3 (1-2 sessions)- Topic 3a: Differentiation & Positioning- Topic 3b: Brand Personality & Essence- Week 3 Conversation Summary & Playback DeliveredWeek 4 (1-2 sessions)- Session 4a: Products & Services (Full Suite)- Session 4b: Launch Offering- Week 4 Conversation Summary & Playback DeliveredPHASE 2a: RESEARCH & STRATEGY (Optional, Skill Required)Week 5 (Research, No Live Sessions)- Contractor conducts market research to understand potential positioning opportunities- Contractor works on and submits recommendations for positioning, messaging, differentiationPHASE 2a: COPYWRITINGWeek 6 (Async Chats, No Live Sessions)- Contractor submits first draft (along with Loom video walk-through explaining approach)- Contractor receives initial feedback (in anticipation of 3 additional revision rounds in the final phase)Week 7-8 (Pre-Scheduled Live Sessions, for Feedback Walk-Through & Discussion)Pre-scheduled revision round walk-throughs and final drafts.- Revision Round 1: (i) Work on Revisions (ii) Submit Feedback & Receive Async Comments, then (iii) Join Pre-Scheduled Session for Live Discussion of Feedback- Revision Round 2: (i) Work on Revisions (ii) Submit Feedback & Receive Async Comments, then (iii) Join Pre-Scheduled Session for Live Discussion of Feedback- Revision Round 3: (i) Work on Revisions (ii) Submit Feedback & Receive Async Comments, then (iii) Join Pre-Scheduled Session for Live Discussion of FeedbackFinalize edits, and submit final deliverables: Company Introduction (Deck) and About Me Landing Page.ADDITIONAL NOTESFinally, the above structure is mainly to illustrate the desired elements ""This is not a learning task! It's an isolated fragment of a real code that will be used in production on multiple devices.You need to implement a "multi-tailed" queue as this:- there are many queues identical in everything but their tail position.- "add" operation changes head of all queues- "poll" operation gets and removes element from the tail of a single queue.- no other changes are possible.- code must be thread-safe, and modifying operations must be atomic.Queues may be really long, and should persist between application invocations. So, they aren't stored in memory but in DB, namely SQLite, using xerial SQLite-JDBC bindings.Item in queue should only be inserted to DB once, not duplicated as many times as there are queues.Deliverables:- an implementation of SqliteStorage class- a set of automated tests that checks this implementation- a SQLite database scheme (although it also should be included in java code to create database if it doesn't exist).Please check code attached and feel free to ask me any questions.Budget: $100Posted On: February 19, 2024 01:25 UTCCategory: Back-End DevelopmentSkills:Java, JDBC, JUnit, Automated Testing, SQLiteSkills: Java, JDBC, JUnit, Automated Testing, SQLiteCountry: Ukraine""

""Securing government contracts in the United States and the European Union requires a deep understanding of the procurement processes, regulations, and compliance standards of both regions. Furthermore, knowledge of EU competition law and state aid rules is critical for ensuring compliance when pursuing government contracts in the EU.The ideal candidate should possess expertise in crafting compelling proposals that meet the specific requirements outlined in government solicitations. This includes demonstrating an understanding of the evaluation criteria used by government agencies in both the US and the EU. Moreover, experience in engaging with government contracting officers, understanding their needs, and building strong relationships with key stakeholders is invaluable for success in this field.In summary, a person experienced in securing government contracts in both the United States and the European Union should possess comprehensive knowledge of federal procurement processes in the US, familiarity with EU public procurement directives and regulations, expertise in crafting competitive proposals, and a proven track record of successful contract awards in both jurisdictions.Budget: $55,000Posted On: February 17, 2024 01:42 UTCCategory: Business & Proposal WritingSkills:Business Strategy, Proposal Writing, Transportation, Automotive, Energy & Utilities, Aerospace, Contract Drafting, Contract Management, Tech & IT, WritingSkills: Business Strategy, Proposal Writing, Transportation, Automotive, Energy & Utilities, Aerospace, Contract Drafting, Contract Management, Tech & IT, WritingCountry: United States""

content: Delivered welcome, the, future-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""Welcome to the future of laptops.You are welcome to join with any amount of people: if you are an individual, no worries!We're looking at increasing the RAM and Hard Drive Capacity as high as possible to keep the laptop powerful. We want it to have efficient cooling that is quiet, as well as a display that looks great. It should be built out of materials that make it feel high quality and solid. We want it to be lightweight and easy to store, but still be powerful and have a sleek design, and boast a long battery life as well as quick charging times. Basically...the holy grail of laptops, if that makes sense.The main limiting factor is the price of this...we were hoping to have this product for sale at around $600-$800. I was very loose with the requirements, using general terminology, for this reason - if your team could find that balance between power and affordability, that would be great. Of course selling it at around $600 would mean manufacturing it at around $300-$400. (All prices in USD)It is okay if you borrow components that are already made from other manufacturers to make this, and we can definitely incorporate diversification under one product. (How Apple charges more money for more storage on the same iPhone, for example.)We plan to fund this buy using income from pre-orders...so keeping the development and manufacturing as cheap as possible is essential.As of right now, I have three major concerns:1. How much will this cost to develop?2. Is this even possible with today's technology?3. When we are ready to develop this, how long will it take?For a little bit of context, this is a start up, and we have no connections anywhere...we're building this up from scratch.If you have any ideas as to what could help make this laptop more appealing, please do add those as you go. Like I said before, we want this to be the "holy grail" of laptops.If you could contact me that would be appreciated about this job, that would be appreciated. That way, we will be able to discuss your capabilities and how much you can help.Thank you for your time reading this.Posted On: February 17, 2024 01:41 UTCCategory: Electronic EngineeringSkills:Circuit Design, Design Simulation, Circuit Diagram, Digital Electronics, Power Electronics, Printed Circuit Board, Electronic Circuit Design, Electrical Engineering, Microcontroller Programming, Electronic Design, PCB Design, Proteus Design Suite, Electrical Design, Laptop, ElectronicsSkills: Circuit Design, Design Simulation, Circuit Diagram, Digital Electronics, Power Electronics, Printed Circuit Board, Electronic Circuit Design, Electrical Engineering, Microcontroller Programming, Electronic Design, PCB Design, Proteus Design Suite, Electrical Design, Laptop, ElectronicsCountry: United States""

""The simulations in the paper "Microgrid Fault Detection, Classification, and Location Based on the Boosting Ensemble Method" will be conducted using MATLAB Simulink software. The authors will model a standard IEC microgrid [REDACTED_PHONE] to validate their proposed algorithm. The microgrid system will be modeled in MATLAB Simulink, representing the lines as frequency-dependent Bergeron distributed line models. Detailed representations of power inverters and other components of the microgrid system will be included.Different operating modes of the network and fault scenarios will be simulated to test the performance of the proposed fault detection and classification algorithm. This will involve setting up various fault conditions and disturbances to evaluate the algorithm's effectiveness.The algorithm for fault detection and classification, based on the Boosting Ensemble Method and minimal overlap discrete wavelet Transform, will be implemented in MATLAB. This will involve processing the current signals from both ends of the line, extracting features using signal processing methods, and training the Brownboost ensemble algorithm.The algorithm will be tested and validated using the simulated microgrid scenarios. Performance metrics such as fault detection accuracy, classification results, and robustness to noise and synchronization errors will be evaluated during the simulations.The results of the simulations will be analyzed to assess the effectiveness of the proposed method in fault detection and classification in microgrids. content: Delivered proposal, legal, advice-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""**Proposal: Legal Advice for Fictional Book Involving Fans of a Popular Rock Band****Introduction:**I am seeking legal advice for an upcoming fictional book project centered around fans of a popular rock band. This project aims to delve into the intricacies of fan culture, fandom communities, and the impact of music on individuals’ lives. Given the sensitive nature of intellectual property rights and potential legal implications surrounding the portrayal of real-life entities, I recognize the necessity of expert legal counsel to navigate these complexities.**Project Overview:**The proposed book revolves around a group of avid fans of a well-known rock band, exploring themes of passion, loyalty, and the blurred lines between reality and fantasy within fan communities. While the narrative primarily focuses on fictional characters and events, it incorporates elements inspired by real-life experiences and the cultural influence of the music industry.**Scope of Legal Assistance:**1. **Intellectual Property Rights:** Assessing the usage of copyrighted material, trademarks, and likenesses associated with the rock band and its members to ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.2. **Defamation and Privacy Concerns:** Reviewing character portrayals, plotlines, and any potentially controversial content to mitigate risks of defamation, invasion of privacy, or misrepresentation of real individuals.3. **Licensing and Permissions:** Advising on the necessity of obtaining licenses or permissions for references to song lyrics, album titles, concert venues, and other copyrighted material, as well as negotiating agreements where applicable.4. **Fan Community Representation:** Providing guidance on accurately depicting fan culture and community dynamics while respecting the rights and privacy of real-life fans and enthusiasts.5. **Contractual Agreements:** Drafting or reviewing contracts with publishers, distributors, and other relevant parties to safeguard my rights and interests in the creative work.**Qualifications:**I am seeking a legal professional with expertise in entertainment law, intellectual property rights, and contract negotiation, preferably with prior experience advising authors, artists, or media producers in similar creative projects. Familiarity with the music industry and fan culture dynamics would be advantageous.**Timeline and Budget:**The project timeline is flexible, with an estimated duration of legal consultation spanning several months to accommodate manuscript development, revisions, and publishing preparations. The budget allocation for legal services will be negotiated based on the scope of work, hourly rates, and anticipated complexities of the project.**Conclusion:**In summary, I believe that securing comprehensive legal advice is essential to the success and integrity of my fictional book project involving fans of a popular rock band. By engaging a qualified legal consultant, I aim to ensure regulatory compliance, mitigate legal risks, and uphold the creative vision while respecting the rights of all parties involved.I look forward to discussing this proposal further and collaborating with a skilled legal professional who shares my passion for storytelling and commitment to ethical representation.Budget: $50Posted On: February 22, 2024 11:04 UTCCategory: Intellectual Property LawSkills:Copyright Prosecution, Legal, Art & Design, Media & Entertainment, Copyright, Intellectual Property LawSkills: Copyright Prosecution, Legal, Art & Design, Media & Entertainment, Copyright, Intellectual Property LawLocation Requirement: Only freelancers located in the United States may apply.Country: United States""

content: Delivered introductionauthor, attribution, the-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""IntroductionAuthor attribution is the task of identifying the author of a given text based on the writing style. In this study, you will evaluate the quality of explanations generated by machine learning models that justify their decision on specific tasks of author attribution. The task consists of two phases: Phase 1 and Phase 2. In the following, we will explain each.Note: Because a portion of the data comes from social media posts, it is possible that you come across potentially distressing content or ideas. However, this content might not be extreme and can be found in public social media. By accepting to perform this task, you agree to participate in this study; you have the right to stop annotating at any time.In both phases, you will solve 70 tasks, each taking between 15 and 20 minutes.Phase 1:This phase consists of solving two types of tasks that we explain below (Task 1 and Task 2). You will be solving 50 tasks in total; each task is expected to take a maximum of 20 minutes to complete.Task 1:Task context. Law enforcement has identified a forum post we call a Query document (Q document). An investigation has resolved the origin of the post to a particular device such that it must have been written by one of the four potential authors: A, B, C, or D. Law enforcement need to know if there is evidence to support identifying one of the suspects for further investigation.Task description. Your task is to read the Query document as well as the posts from each author and determine which of the candidate authors is likely to have written the Query documents. In some of these tasks, you will also be given extra explanations of the linguistic, stylistic, and/or semantic features of the Query document, as well as posts from each author.Then, only if this information is given, you will have to answer a set of questions on the quality of explanations.Task 2:Task context. Same as Task 1 contextTask description. This time, you will be presented with an AI agent’s prediction of the Query document's author and the machine-generated explanation that justifies this prediction. Your task is to judge different aspects of the explanation you just saw with respect to the prediction.Annotation PlatformOn the annotation platform, click on the “Author Attribution Explanation” project. You will then be prompted with a summary of the instructions, and then you can start the evaluation. The total 50 tasks are composed of 10 sets of 5 tasks each, sequentially presented to you. Each set consists of the same Query and Author documents. The first task in the set consists of you solving the Type 1 task without any provided explanations. The second and third tasks in the set consist of you solving the Type 1 task but with explanations provided by two systems (describing the documents’ writing style and the overall similarity). The fourth and fifth tasks are of Type 2, where we additionally show the AI agent prediction by the two systems, and you have to answer questions regarding the prediction.Noe: More details on this Phase can be found in the Phase 1 Study Instruction and Info Sheet in the attachments.Phase 2:For each task, you will be presented with a query document and four candidate documents, along with the AI’s prediction of the author of the query document with explanations of the decision. Then, you will reason about the AI’s prediction on a follow-up document. You are to guess what the AI would predict. In total, you will solve 20 tasks.Note that your task is NOT to annotate the correct answers to the follow-up questions but rather guess the Robot's answers based on its explanation and answer in the starter text.Budget: $500Posted On: February 13, 2024 18:12 UTCCategory: Experimentation & TestingSkills:Content Writing, Linguistics, Writing, Natural Language ProcessingSkills: Content Writing, Linguistics, Writing, Natural Language ProcessingLocation Requirement: Only freelancers located in the United States may apply.Country: United States""

Be sure to identify the need, counter possible objections, outline the benefits, and include actionable next steps. Boost your credibility by using information from outside resources as well as at least 3 references from our case. Organize each of these elements persuasively, and be sure your document is clear, concise, and cohesive.The AssignmentPersuasive MemoCompose a 1-2 page, block paragraph memo arguing for hiring outside translators for future meetings with the Japan-based teams.Your memo should follow best practices and formatting conventions for US business. Additionally, your memo must:Follow a direct structureIdentify and address your readers’ needs and concernsUtilize our case, your research, and persuasionCite sources with APA citations in footnotesBe organized for ease of reading and referenceAppeal to Pathos, Logos, and EthosConclude with proposed next stepsAssignment 3: Bad News LetterThe ScenarioIn this assignment, you are Peter Street, CEO of AXR (you may use your own name on the documents, however).Jackson Maulberry, a Research and Development leader for you at AXR, has identified some important improvements in microchip technology that could benefit both your American and Japanese clients. He has delivered presentations on the technology to the engineers and, subsequently, to you directly. You believe the advance in technology would be very important for AXR and its parent company, Japan Motors, and that Jackson has a good plan for integrating the technology into your current engineering practices.With your approval, Jackson began developing a pitch and planning for a trip to Japan. You know he had been hoping for an opportunity like this since the acquisition, but you have come to realize that "if one of your team members gave a presentation to the Japanese managers, they essentially paid no attention."Write a bad news letter to Jackson explaining that he has no reason to pack his bags; his presentation will be delivered to upper-management by a Japan-based colleague. Be sure to lead with a rationale for the bad news, and to develop a resolution that will keep Jackson focused on continuing his good work.As you write, be sure to use at least one detail or reference from our case and ensure that you control the tone of your message with strategic word choice.The AssignmentCompose a 1-page, block paragraph letter on letterhead from CEO Peter Street to Jackson Maulberry.Your letter should follow best practices and formatting conventions for US business.Additionally, you must:Give neutral contextExplain the details, rationale, and stakesAppropriately deliver the bad news, using our best practicesReference our case at least 1 timeControl tone, word choice, and flow of messagingResolve the scenario in a way that does not require further communicationBudget: $105Posted On: February 19, 2024 14:37 UTCCategory: Business & Proposal WritingSkills:Business Writing, English, Writing, Persuasive Writing, Persuasive ToneSkills: Business Writing, English, Writing, Persuasive Writing, Persuasive ToneLocation Requirement: Only freelancers located in the United States may apply.Country: United States""

Each individual section would be on a different page (i.e. not all 40 questions will be visible in one go), and each page to have a back and next button.All questions would be compulsory and the respondent would not be able to move to the next page/section without answering all the questions in the specific page.I will be happy to consider and explore creative suggestions around the survey construct.At the end of the survey, a separate section will capture the respondent details, NAME, email ID, Title, Organization Name, Organization Website, Size of the Organization, Industry, and Geography. The Size, Industry, and Geography fields will have a predefined drop-down list, while other fields will be free text. Free Text fields would need to have some mechanism (if possible) to check that no random content is entered.Once the respondent has completed the survey, two things need to happen.1. Summary and Section-wise Score to be generated for the completed survey AND emailed to the respondent in a pre defined template comprising ---- Overall Score, Standard text for each of the 11 sections, specific score for the individual 11 sections, a standard pre-defined text (5 possibilities) based on the overall score, and a standard text asking the respondent to get in touch to discuss the scores along with a link to schedule a meeting2. The individual responses to individual questions and demographic details from each completed survey are to be shifted to a meta-database on a pre-defined Google Drive as individual records, which can be extracted into a .csv or .xls format.It's difficult to predict at this stage the number of respondents, but I would like to plan for the solution to be capable of flexible and scalable.If this effort requires any separate hardware or software license, those costs would be borne by me.Lastly, the quoted budget is indicative. Wir bieten Dir die Möglichkeit, mit uns an Bord zu gehen, mit uns zu lernen und neue Fähigkeiten für die Zukunft zu erwerben.- Es handelt sich um eine freiberufliche Tätigkeit, die neben anderen Aufgaben auch in Teilzeit ausgeübt werden kann. Wir hoffen jedoch, dass Du mit uns in die Tiefe gehst, Dich an unserer Gemeinschaft und Zusammenarbeit beteiligst und mit uns zusammen wächst.Hourly Range: $15.00Posted On: February 19, 2024 23:14 UTCCategory: AI Content WritingSkills:German, Content Writing, Writing, Copywriting, Article Writing, Creative Writing, Website Content, Article, Blog ContentSkills: German, Content Writing, Writing, Copywriting, Article Writing, Creative Writing, Website Content, Article, Blog ContentCountry: Serbia""

content: Delivered design, brief, promo-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""Design Brief: Promo Video for a DJ PerformanceOverviewWe require a dynamic and high-energy promo video for a DJ performance to be featured in the lead-up to a live music event. The video should capture the excitement and intensity of the music, creating anticipation and enthusiasm among the audience.ObjectiveCreate an engaging promo video that showcases the DJ's energy and music style, incorporating fast-paced transitions, captivating footage, and a strong brand connection to The Festival.Design Requirements- Intro: The video should start with an exciting introduction using a potential cut-out video effect (words cut out more visible to the background - examples can be provided). This should instantly grab the viewer's attention.- Main Content: Transition through various video footage showcasing the DJ's performances, crowd interactions, and high-energy moments. The content should be rhythmically synced to a powerful track that embodies the DJ's style.- Exit: Conclude with The Festival logo, ensuring a strong brand connection and leaving the audience with anticipation for the event.- Duration: The video should be exactly 30 seconds to maintain viewer engagement and effectively convey the message within a concise timeframe.Video Formats & Export Requirements- Landscape: Export in HD video sizes, specifically 1920px by 1080px, suitable for YouTube and general web use.- Portrait: Create a version in Instagram Stories sizes, which is 1080px by 1920px, to cater to social media marketing efforts.- Square: Additionally, produce a square version (1080px by 1080px) for platforms that favor this format like Instagram feed posts.- Output Files: Final outputs should be provided in MP3 format for the audio to ensure compatibility across various platforms. Additionally, provide After Effects native files for potential future edits or adjustments.Creative Direction- Tone & Energy: The video should exude excitement and high energy, reflecting the vibrant and dynamic nature of the DJ's music and live performances.- Visuals & Effects: Utilize fast-paced transitions, bright colors, and engaging visual effects that align with the rhythm and energy of the background track. Footage should be high quality, capturing the essence of live performances and the connection with the audience.- Music Background: All video assets will be provided, and the video should be set to a music background. The selected track should represent the DJ's music style—energetic, captivating, and able to drive the video's pace and transitions.Deliverables- Promo video in three formats: landscape (1920px by 1080px), portrait (1080px by 1920px), and square (1080px by 1080px).- Exported audio files in MP3 format.- After Effects project files, including all assets used in the video.Timeline- Provide a timeline for initial drafts and expect rounds of revisions.- Final deliverables should be approved and delivered ASAPNotes for the Designer- Ensure the video and all its elements are cohesive and maintain the brand identity of The Festival.- The video should be suitable for a wide range of platforms, from social media to large-scale event screens, maintaining its impact across different viewing contexts.- Keep in mind the target audience's preferences and expectations for a live music event, aiming to generate excitement and anticipation for the DJ's performance.Please reach out for any clarifications or additional information needed.Budget: $150Posted On: February 19, 2024 23:13 UTCCategory: Video ProductionSkills:MP4, MOV, Action, Video Editing, Video Production, Video Post-Editing, Adobe After Effects, Videography, Trailer, Audio EditingSkills: MP4, MOV, Action, Video Editing, Video Production, Video Post-Editing, Adobe After Effects, Videography, Trailer, Audio EditingCountry: United Kingdom""
